intro: Ornithogalum brevipedicellatum, commonly known as the short-stemmed star-of-Bethleham, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in fynbos vegetation and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
